# Robert Swain's jury

```{python}
import numpy as np
import numpy.random as npr
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')
# %matplotlib inline
```

```{python}
npr.uniform()
```

```{python}
juror = npr.uniform()
juror
```

```{python}
juror < 0.26
```

```{python}
juror = npr.uniform()
juror < 0.26
```

```{python}
jurors = npr.uniform(size=12)
jurors
```

```{python}
jurors = npr.uniform(size=12)
jurors < 0.26
```

```{python}
jurors = npr.uniform(size=12)
is_black = jurors < 0.26
is_black
```

```{python}
jurors = npr.uniform(size=12)
is_black = jurors < 0.26
np.count_nonzero(is_black)
```

```{python}
counts = np.zeros(10, int)
counts
```

```{python}
counts = np.zeros(10, int)
for i in range(10):
    jurors = npr.uniform(size=12)
    is_black = jurors < 0.26
    counts[i] = np.count_nonzero(is_black)
counts
```

```{python}
counts == 0
```

```{python}
np.count_nonzero(counts == 0)
```

```{python}
counts = np.zeros(10000, int)
for i in range(10000):
    jurors = npr.uniform(size=12)
    is_black = jurors < 0.26
    counts[i] = np.count_nonzero(is_black)
counts
```

```{python}
plt.hist(counts);
```

```{python}
n_with_0_black = np.count_nonzero(counts == 0)
n_with_0_black
```

```{python}
n_with_0_black / 10000
```
